title: Sweetcorn (bowl)

It can be made by using a bowl on a cooked sweetcorn; this does not require a knife, nor does it provide any Cooking experience. As food, when eaten, it provides healing identical to cooked sweetcorn, namely 1+10% of total hitpoints, rounded down. A bowl of sweetcorn is called "Sweetcorn" in-game. This may cause confusion among players as raw sweetcorn has the same in-game name.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Sweetcorn (bowl)
This article is about a bowl of sweetcorn. For uncooked sweetcorn, see sweetcorn.

Item ID7088

A bowl of sweetcorn (in game name "Sweetcorn") is both food and a cooking ingredient. It can be made by using a bowl on a cooked sweetcorn; this does not require a knife, nor does it provide any Cooking experience. As food, when eaten, it provides healing identical to cooked sweetcorn, namely 1+10% of total hitpoints, rounded down. A bowl of sweetcorn is called "Sweetcorn" in-game. This may cause confusion among players as raw sweetcorn has the same in-game name.

Its primary use is as an ingredient in making tuna and corn. At level 67 Cooking, with a knife in inventory, members can use a bowl of sweetcorn with cooked tuna to create tuna and corn. This mixture heals 13 hitpoints when eaten, but is usually added to a potato with butter at level 68 Cooking to create a tuna potato that heals 22 hitpoints.

[[File:Sweetcorn (bowl) detail.png|left|150px]]
A '''bowl of sweetcorn''' (in game name "Sweetcorn") is both [[food]] and a cooking ingredient. It can be made by using a [[bowl]] on a [[cooked sweetcorn]]; this does not require a [[knife]], nor does it provide any [[Cooking]] [[experience]]. As [[food]], when eaten, it provides healing identical to [[cooked sweetcorn]], namely 1+10% of total hitpoints, rounded down. A bowl of '''sweetcorn''' is called "Sweetcorn" in-game. This may cause confusion among players as [[sweetcorn|raw sweetcorn]] has the same in-game name.

Its primary use is as an ingredient in making [[tuna and corn]]. At level 67 Cooking, with a knife in inventory, members can use a bowl of sweetcorn with cooked [[tuna]] to create tuna and corn. This mixture heals 13 [[hitpoints]] when eaten, but is usually added to a [[potato with butter]] at level 68 Cooking to create a [[tuna potato]] that heals 22 [[hitpoints]].
